page.title: 11Fulscot Farm, E. Hagbourne-2
page.content: The soils are heavy clay and Greensand. On the stoney soils, feed barley is grown. The wheat, sown in September, is high protein and used for milling to produce bread. Grass is cut for silage in July and taken to a pit at the dairy. 1000 tons of grain are fed into a grain drier. The barley is rolled and in the hopper other ingredients are added eg sugar beet pulp. There are 50ton bins for grain storage. A tractor loads grain onto a conveyer to be taken to Wallingford or Southampton. There is still an old granary in the grounds with arches beneath to keep grain off the wet ground, built of timber and red brick. Other buildings include a brick barn, a workshop, 300 yr old farmhouse, and a new house and offices, and a grain store.There are 3 full time workers and machine repairs are done by suppliers.
